summary:
CLAIM: Donald Trump claims that campaigning on open borders and higher taxes is a losing strategy.

SUMMARY: During a debate in Trump Huntington on November 2nd, 2018, Donald Trump questions the logic of campaigning on open borders and higher taxes, stating that he doesn't understand how one can win with such a platform. He argues that his administration has already started building the wall with 1.6 billion dollars and has secured additional funding. Trump expresses his desire to build the wall all at once and urges the audience to go home and witness the actions of the military on the border.

CLAIM: Donald Trump claims that the United States gives hundreds of millions of dollars to countries like Honduras and El Salvador, while receiving nothing in return.

SUMMARY: During a debate in Trump Huntington on November 2nd, 2018, Donald Trump argued that the Democrats want to invite caravans of migrants into the country. He claimed that the United States gives hundreds of millions of dollars to countries like Honduras and El Salvador, while receiving nothing in return. Trump stated that this practice of providing financial aid to these countries will be stopped.

CLAIM: Donald Trump claims that Democrats want to sign illegal aliens up for free healthcare, free welfare, free education, and the right to vote.

SUMMARY: During a debate in Trump Huntington on November 2nd, 2018, Donald Trump argued that Democrats' plan to destroy healthcare includes raiding Medicare to fund benefits for illegal immigrants. He claimed that Democrats are openly encouraging millions of illegal aliens to violate laws and overrun borders, wanting to provide them with free healthcare, welfare, education, and voting rights. Trump emphasized the need to use resources to help low-income Americans who respect the laws, rather than supporting illegal immigrants.

Donald Trump claimed during a debate in Trump Huntington on November 2nd, 2018 that the Democrats want to raise taxes, restore job-killing regulations, and shut down coal mines. He guaranteed that the Democrats will shut down coal mines and stated that he will veto any tax increases.

CLAIM: Donald Trump claims that the Democrats want to raise taxes and shut down coal mines.

SUMMARY: During a debate in Trump Huntington on November 2nd, 2018, Donald Trump argued that the Democrats aim to raise taxes and shut down coal mines. He guaranteed that the Democrats would shut down coal mines and emphasized that they want to raise taxes substantially.

CLAIM: Donald Trump questions how Democrats can win by campaigning on open borders and higher taxes.

SUMMARY: During a debate in Trump Huntington on November 2nd, 2018, Donald Trump questions how Democrats can win by campaigning on open borders and higher taxes, expressing confusion over their strategy.

Claim: Donald Trump claims that Democrats want to open the borders and implement socialism, which would turn America into Venezuela.

Summary: During a debate in Trump Huntington on November 2nd, 2018, Donald Trump argued that Democrats would shut down coal mines, take away good healthcare, and open the borders. He claimed that Democrats want to use socialism to turn America into Venezuela. Trump questioned how Democrats could win with a campaign focused on open borders and higher taxes. He also mentioned the progress made on building the wall with allocated funds.

Donald Trump claimed at the Trump Huntington event on November 2nd, 2018 that he has successfully reduced healthcare costs, signed the largest bill to fight the opioid epidemic, passed Veterans Choice and the VA accountability law, and secured funding to rebuild the United States military.
